pull.title: Render icons from SVG
pull.body: This probably doesn't make sense to merge to Core itself due to the added dependencies (rsvg & imagemagick; and icnsutils for Mac) and risks (of installed rsvg mis-rendering the SVG), but posting it here (insta-close) for potential review and/or cherry-picking.

events.message: Reuse Windows ICO for Windows installer

gitian: Dependencies for rendering icons

icnsutils is needed on linux/win for generating the .icns in source tarball

events.body: (Leaving it open for final branch updates/Travis testing)

events.message: Rather than clean generated icons, plan to distribute them
Add 8-bit icon to make builds deterministic again
Travis: Include dependencies for building icons

events.body: Ok, this seems to be working good now.
Why the instaclose? If it's good enough for Knots, then why wouldn't it be good enough for Core? And if it's not needed for Core, then why is it needed for Knots?
